name: Corn Tortillas
author: jenn
summary: This is the real thing!  A simple mixture of masa harina and water results in the most wonderful corn tortillas you ever tasted. The secret is to use a cast iron pan! You can buy masa harina at Mexican grocery stores or in the ethnic food aisle of large supermarkets.
directions: In a medium bowl, mix together   and hot water until thoroughly combined
Turn dough onto a clean surface and knead until pliable and smooth
If dough is too sticky, add more masa harina; if it begins to dry out, sprinkle with water
Cover dough tightly with plastic wrap and allow to stand for 30 minutes
Preheat a cast iron skillet or griddle to medium-high
Using a tortilla press, a rolling pin, or your hands, press each ball of dough flat between two sheets of plastic wrap
Immediately place tortilla in preheated pan and allow to cook for approximately 30 seconds, or until browned and slightly puffy
Turn tortilla over to brown on second side for approximately 30 seconds more, then transfer to a plate
Repeat process with each ball of dough
Keep tortillas covered with a towel to stay warm and moist until ready to serve
